announcements.title: The Cathedral is Re-Opening!
announcements.descriptive:
We have events planned for this weekend and next!
And **Weekday Mass** resumes Tuesday!
[See below](#schedule2) for event times.

Please note The Cathedral will be closed Monday June 15.

Our schedule will be updated during the process of re-opening.
Be sure to
[join our mailing list](https://mailchi.mp/ac8e8cadb5e8/dont-miss-out)
for the latest updates as they happen!

announcements.title: Ushers needed!
announcements.descriptive:
We are calling for volunteers to assist as ushers inside The Cathedral
during Holy Mass and with cleaning between Masses.
**Needed are a minimum of four ushers.**

Training, masks, and gloves will be provided.
Volunteers will be asked to sign a waiver.

We need **you**!
Many thanks to all those who step forward!

announcements.title: Discerning Our Future
announcements.subtitle: Planning for the Next Five to Ten Years
announcements.descriptive:
As church closures come to an end in Ontario,
The Cathedral is seeking your input on our future.
Please tell us how we can best serve you, our parishioners.

We invite you to complete a short survey.
Your responses will be crucial in helping us plan for the years ahead.

[Take the survey...](https://forms.gle/Cod2ub2cf7g5rgzN9)

announcements.title: Join our mailing list
announcements.descriptive:
Be the first to know!
Stay in the loop with everything going on at The Cathedral.

Sign up to receive regular updates, announcements, links to bulletins, and more,
delivered straight to your inbox!

Let's stay connected.

[Sign up...](https://mailchi.mp/ac8e8cadb5e8/dont-miss-out)

announcements.title: Bishop Miehm's Video Message for the Re-Opening of Parishes
announcements.descriptive:
Bishop Miehm outlines plans for the re-opening of parishes
throughout the Diocese of Peterborough.

[Watch on YouTube...](https://youtu.be/txXUPp1XXD0)

announcements.title: Worship Safe
announcements.subtitle: Re-Opening Plan for the Diocese of Peterborough
announcements.descriptive:
The Diocese of Peterborough has drawn up a set of directives for the
re-opening of the parishes, entitled *Worship Safe*.

[Read...](https://www.peterboroughdiocese.org/en/resourcesGeneral/Homepage-banners/COVID-19/Worship-Safe/June-9-2020-WorshipSafe-RCDio-Peterborough.pdf)

announcements.title: Letter on the Re-Opening of Parishes
announcements.descriptive:
Bishop Miehm published a letter to the parishes
concerning preparations for re-opening.

[Read...](https://www.peterboroughdiocese.org/en/resourcesGeneral/Homepage-banners/COVID-19/Reopening/Lttr-Faithful-BishopDJM-June-10-2020.pdf)

regularEvents.title: Weekend Mass
regularEvents.descriptive:
**Welcome back!**
We invite you to attend our first Weekend Masses since the lockdowns!

In order to meet the re-opening guidelines which limit church capacity to 30%,
we will hold a total of six Weekend Mass events over June 20 and 21.

**Parishioners are asked to attend the scheduled Mass
corresponding with the initial of their surname:**

**June 20**

Surname initials A, D, E, F: **5:00 PM**

Surname initials B, C: **6:30 PM**

**June 21**

Surname initials G, H, I, J: **7:30 AM**

Surname initials L, M: **9:00 AM**

Surname initials K, N through R: **10:30 AM**

Surname initials S through Z: **12:00 PM**

This arrangement is tentative and may evolve in the coming weeks.

regularEvents.title: Weekday Mass
regularEvents.descriptive:
**Welcome back!**
We invite you to attend our first morning and midday Weekday Masses
since the lockdowns! Weekday Mass resumes Tuesday June 16.

Parishioners are asked to maintain social distancing.

specialEvents.title: Outdoor Confession
specialEvents.descriptive:
Come Saturday afternoon to participate in the Holy Sacrament of Reconciliation.

Two priests will be available, one serving parishioners in their vehicles, and one to serve parishioners at the doorway of Bishop Doyle Hall.

Parishioners are asked to follow the signs and maintain social distancing.

**Take a spin, bring your sin!**

specialEvents.title: Adoration
specialEvents.descriptive:
Please join us the morning of June 14 in Adoration of the Blessed Sacrament.

Parishioners are asked to maintain social distancing.

specialEvents.title: Sunday Mass
specialEvents.subtitle: The Feast of Corpus Christi
specialEvents.descriptive:
Celebrated at The Cathedral by Bishop Daniel Miehm,
this very special Mass airs on Channel 10 and 700 on Cogeco Cable and
will be available on YouTube.

[Watch on YouTube...](https://youtu.be/Bmw-_hCaPJY)

bulletins.title: Solemnity of the Most Holy Trinity
